alert.note: Alert for Somervell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Erath, Hood and Somervell County in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glen Rose, Dinosaur Valley State Park, Squaw Creek Reservoir, Bluff Dale, Paluxy, Chalk Mountain, Johnsville, Rainbow and Nemo.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
